title_sort: g. m. williamson to walt whitman, 1 june 1887
title: G. M. Williamson to Walt Whitman, 1 June 1887
text: No. 8 Franklin Place,Belfast, IrelandMANUFACTURERS AND IMPORTERS OF L.C. HANDKERCHIEFS AND LINENS.GLENDINNING, McLEISH & CO.32 WALKER STREET, Cor. Church St.New York, June 1st 1887 Dear Mr. Whitman I entendedintended that this should have reached you on May 31st but being out of Town I was unable to send itPlease except the Enclosed small remembrance and I hope that you will live to see many springs & Summers with them Birds & Blossoms and yourself Enjoying good health and prosperity.I remain yoursGM WilliamsonOrange buds by mailA lesser proof than Voltaire's, yet greater,Not as the keen Voltaire,A lesser proof than his yet greaterTo my plain Northern hut, in outside clouds and snow,Proof of to-day, and thee, thy broad expanse, America,Some three days since on their own soil live sprouting,Now here their sweetness through my room diffusingA bunch of orange buds by mail from Florida.Brought for a thousand miles o'er land and tide. G. M. Williamson to Walt Whitman, 1 June 1887
